Once upon a time, there was a huge dog named Max. Max liked to observe everything around him. He was a very curious dog. One day, Max was playing in the park with his friends when something strange happened.
The ground started to shake. It was an earthquake! Max and his friends were scared, but they knew they had to be brave. They all held hands and stayed close together. The shaking stopped after a little while, and everyone was safe.

The little girl was scared, but said, "I was just examining the table."
The man replied, "You can't touch that. That table is delicate and is made from a special material."
The little girl said, "I'm sorry. I didn't mean to do anything wrong."
The man looked at her and smiled, "I know you were just exploring, but you still can't touch the table."
The little girl thanked the man, and the two went their separate ways, the little girl once again exploring the world around her.

Once upon a time, there was a foolish little squirrel. He wanted to print something, so he ran to the printing shop. The shopkeeper gave him some paper. He then asked for some milk, but the shopkeeper said there wasn't any.
The squirrel was very disappointed and asked 'Why not?'
The shopkeeper laughed and said, 'You're so foolish, squirrel! Printing doesn't need milk, it needs ink.'

Jimmy said, "I would like a x-ray, please." The doctor nodded and took him to the x-ray room.
When they got there, the doctor said, "I'd like you to stand still while I take the x-ray."
But Jimmy was feeling lazy, so he started talking and laughing and moving around. "Don't ignore the doctor," his mom said sternly.

So, Billy and Elly spent the day playing together on the ground. They had lots of fun and Elly was not frustrated anymore. They were very happy friends.

The bird nodded and said, "Yes! You can come with me! We can touch the sunshine together." This made the little girl very happy.
